case.state: When the game starts, sets the persistent marker isPlaying. This marker is used to give Monika awareness of the game being reset, and will only be cleared if the game finishes properly.

state.text: Resets the "realization" markers if someone wants to see the dialogue chain again.

You remind me a bit of one of my club members, Fluttershy. Could you offer some insight as to how...less outgoing people think?

Have you had any... encounters with anyone during a war? Being close to death often gets people seeking comfort and release. Ahaha~

Very funny, Amy. You've got the whole club laughing.
Hey, Sayaka, are you a schoolgirl? If so, your school has quite the interesting uniform... white with a yellow accent.
Sayaka, you're a schoolgirl, right? Your school has an interesting uniform... it makes me think of a sunrise with those yellow accents.
You said you were from space, Jim? What do you do in space?
You said you were from space, right Jim? What do you do there?
It's Lux, right? Fitting, since your armor is bright and gleaming. Where are you from?
Your name's Lux, right? Quite appropriate, given how shiny your armor is. Where do you hail from?
Your outfit is rather elaborate, Miko. Resplendent, even. What do you do for a living, if anything?
Intricate garb like that isn't something one sees every day. What sort of position do you hold, Miko, if any?
I get the impression that you have a curious mind, Fina. Are you much of a reader at all?
You seem to be impressively curious, Fina. That's very admirable. Do you enjoy reading much?
I think I heard you say something about animals, Fluttershy? Do you work with them?
You work with animals regularly, right Fluttershy? I think you alluded to that earlier.
You seem keen on winning a prize of some sort, Nami. Anything in particular you'd like to get?
Since you're so interested in prizes, Nami, what would you be spending the cash on?
What do you intend to do with all the money you earn and save, Nami? Preparing for early retirement, or do you need it for something else?
What's your plan for all the money you're getting, Nami? A big savings account, or something else?
You work as an idol, right Saki? Do you write lyrics at all?
Does your idol work involve writing the lyrics for your music, Saki?
Based on what I've learned about you, Chara, your participation here makes little sense. Care to explain?
I don't get exactly why you're here, Chara. I know enough about your... interests, and this isn't one of them.
You've fought in at least one war, right, Jim? Was it one with a worthy cause or something you were forced into?
You've served in a war before, right, Jim? Do you think it had a just cause or not?
I understand that you're...on the wrong side of the law back home, Meia? Is it hard living a marginalized life like that?
I gather that you have a...less than ideal status with law enforcement on Mejare, right Meia? Is that a difficult life?
You're a student too, right Mari? What's your major?
I gather that you're a student like me, Mari? What field are you in?
I haven't met many people passionate about gardening, Basil. What drew you to it?
I understand you like gardening, Basil? What about it do you find rewarding?
Could you explain this "PSI" thing you've been mentioning, Kumatora? I can't say I've heard of it before...
If you don't mind, could you tell us more about "PSI", Kumatora? I'm out of the loop on it...
Have you been in a relationship before, Meia? Since Mejare is all female, I supposed it'd be with another woman...
Do you have a significant other, Meia? Or used to? Dating on an all-female planet must be different from Earth...
Is accumulating money at the front of your mind all the time, Nami? I can understand that if you have a pressing bill coming due, or if you're preparing for retirement.
Are you all about earning money, Nami? It's not a bad plan, if you're aiming for early retirement or have some big expense coming up.
I hate to break it to you, Aaravi, but I think you're mistaken about the type of game we're in...
Sorry to say this, Aaravi, but I don't think this is the type of game you seem to think it is...
So, Stocking... Do you usually make your own sweets or buy them? My club member Natsuki loves to bake and brings her creations in sometimes.
"Twisted Fate" is a clever play on your initials, Mr. Felix. Do your marks usually believe it's your actual name?
I have to say, calling yourself "Twisted Fate" is a creative reference to your actual initials, Mr. Felix. Is it common for your marks to think that's your real name?
I started teaching myself piano fairly recently. Do you have any advice on how to improve faster?
I've been teaching myself piano for a little while. Any tips for a beginner would be much appreciated.
I know your experience with men is limited, but have any of them shown qualities that you respect?
Even if you haven't interacted with men that much, have you seen any who had attributes that you respected?
You're quite the expert in pampering people, Senko. Could you offer a few pointers on spoiling someone when they... live far away from you?
I can tell that you're passionate about pampering people, Senko. I was wondering-- how would someone go about spoiling their partner in... a long-distance relationship?
(~Player~, is there something I'm not seeing in this girl that's appealing to you?) So, Tomoko, what do you like to do after school?
(I'm not sure why you'd want to play a game like this with a girl like her, ~player~, but I'll play along.) So, Tomoko, what do you get up to in your free time?
Reforming wrongdoers to get them out of Hell is a noble goal, Charlie. You've got a qualified team to help you, right?
Rescuing wayward souls so they can escape Hell is a respectable goal, Charlie. I assume you've got some talented people on your team to help?
I'm curious, Charlie-- have you encountered any AI intelligences in Hell that were deleted, or is it only organic people who go there?
I've been wondering, Charlie-- does Hell have any synthetic individuals who died or were deleted? Or do only flesh and blood people go there?
Charlie, does an immoral act make a person immoral if all the consequences are completely undone? Strange hypothetical, I know. Just wondering your opinion.
Do you think an unethical act makes one permanently unethical, even if the person who commits it undoes all the effects? Kind of an abstract question, I know. Just curious as to what you think.
You're pretty good at convincing people to help you, right, Hilda? Know any tricks that seem to work well?
How do you persuade other people to do you a favor so well, Hilda? I could use some pointers, if you have any.

Do you find it difficult to connect to all your organic fans as a digital intelligence, Miku? They're... very different qualia.
So, Petra, you're learning to speak Fdlan's common tongue, right? You seem to be close to fluency-- I can understand you perfectly fine.
Fdlan's common tongue is a second language to you, right, Petra? I can understand you completely, so you must be close to fluency.

You've... taken people's lives before, right, Petra? Does it bother you at all?

Samus, I understand that the Chozo trained you to be their greatest warrior? To you, is that a fulfilling goal to reach for, or an onerous burden?

What's this "Life Gem" you mentioned, Nadia? It's a rather grandiose name...

What did you mean by ascending to the level of "eternal celestial"?

Beacon Academy is a combat school, right? How is everything organized?
How does Beacon Academy organize its curriculum? It's a school for combat, right?
You can travel between different worlds, Erufuda? How does that work, exactly?
You came to this world from your own somehow, right, Erufuda? I'd like to know more.
I know you deal with the deceased all the time, Hu Tao, but how do you feel about people who kill others, for whatever reason?
I get that you're comfortable with the end of life, Hu Tao, but what are your feelings towards those who end lives, willingly or otherwise?
You're an expert in creation myths, right, Cynthia? Do any involve the universe being some sort of simulation?
You study creation myths, right, Cynthia? Some people believe that the universe is a simulation-- are there any you know like that?
You seem to have met ~player~ before, Noire. How do you know each other?
Where do you know ~player~ from, Noire? I gather that you've been acquainted.
You seem like the sociable type, Miki. What do you like to do with your friends?
I gather that you're a pretty outgoing person, Miki. What do you get up to with friends?

Hey, Reimu-- have you ever dyed your hair purple in the past? Just curious.
So, Reimu, have you always had your hair like that, or did you used to dye it? Like, say, purple?
So, "Amy"... How did you join the club again? I'm afraid that I've forgotten...

I keep getting the impression you have a problem with me. Care to explain?

Could you tell us about how the multiverse and shifting between realities works? It's been on my mind for a while.
You might be used to Tarak's men hating women, Meia, but on Earth men usually seek out female attention. There's even a whole genre of games that simulate having a girlfriend.
Despite the attitudes of the men of Tarak, men on Earth usually have a strong desire to interact with women. A whole genre of games called dating sims exists to recreate the experience.
You run some kind of mall called the "Join Avenue", right, Rosa? What kind of shops can I find there?
You're in charge of a shopping mall, right, Rosa? "Join Avenue", I think? What sort of stores are there?
I think it's safe to assume you're into the sciences, right, Heris? What attracted you to them over the humanities?
You work in a STEM field, right, Heris? Why did you choose that over, say, a humanities subject?
You're a pretty spiritual person, right, Ignatz? I've always been sorta on the fence about a higher power existing.

I get the impression that you have a packed schedule, Mari. How do you find time for your boyfriend?

Hey, Noelle, could you help me with something? I'm trying to be more helpful to my club members, but I still have to keep up with my studies. Do you have any suggestions?
Could I ask your advice on something, Noelle? I'm supposed to assist my club members as much as I can as president, but I also need to keep up on my studies. Any tips?
I'm a bit curious, Mari-- what do you look for in a man? Seems like you have some skin in the game there.
What qualities do you look for in a guy, Mari? I get the impression you're quite interested in them.
Blake, right? Have you ever felt like you're a second-class citizen in your life?
It's Blake, right? Is lacking self-determination for your own life something you've struggled with?
You're descended from the Vesani, right, Ahri? I was curious about their technology that harnessed thoughts and emotions for energy.
Do you know much about how the Vesani used thoughts and emotions to power their machines, Ahri? I heard you're descended from them.
Being a superhero can't be easy. How far would you go to accomplish a greater good, Supernova?
I imagine that superheroism isn't smiles and sunshine all the time. How much would you be willing to do to protect others, Supernova?
Do you see much in the way of poetry being written in fan circles, Zoe? I know prose is common. Like, fanfiction counts as prose.
How much poetry do you see in fandoms, Zoe? Prose is very common given the all the fanfiction that exists, but I haven't heard of famous fan poems.
I understand you're quite well-read, right, Estelle? Do you want to be an author yourself?
You're big into reading, right, Estelle? Are you planning to become an author?
Does Arcadia have any sort of literary canon? Like, important classics that most other works take inspiration from?
Is there a literary canon of sorts in Arcadia? Like, a set of works that are extremely influential to all other fiction?
What's the greatest challenge you've faced as a warrior, Samus? I imagine there's more than a few contenders...
Which fight do you think was the most challenging in your career as a warrior, Samus? I wouldn't be surprised if it's hard to choose.
Which artists does Franchouchou draw its music inspiration from the most, Saki?
Who are the biggest influences on Franchouchou's music, Saki?
Will "defeating" enemies here really give you the same feeling that it did where you come from? The stakes are far lower.
Somehow I don't think your obsession with "defeating" people will apply well here. The stakes aren't nearly the same.
Based on your name and trade, I have to ask: any relation to Alessandro Cagliostro?
"Cagliostro", eh? Are you related at all to Alessandro Cagliostro? You're even an alchemist too!

W-whoa, ~name~, your hair is... uh, unique. I've never seen that color hair on anyone before. I'd ask if you dyed it, but there are enough people in this game with weird hair colors that I'd probably be wrong.
~Name~, your hair is pretty messy. ...do you get up late, or anything? I have a friend who can be the same way at times, ehehe...

W-whoa, ~name~, your hair is pretty unique. It reminds me of a friend of mine in the Literature Club who's into fantasy. She's quite a mysterious, yet charming person. Ahaha~

You know, ~name~, you didn't need to bring the armor. We're not out to try or kill you, or anything... I hope.

You look really stylish, ~name~! ...you know, now I kind of wish this game could let me wear something else for once...
Oh, ~name~, you seem to be the type to play games... just out of curiosity: what do you think of dating sims?
Don't those horns get in the way, ~name~? Or do you just get used to them, somehow?
~Name~, I have a question: why are you even here? You don't seem to care about seeing us strip at all.

I-I'm kind of wondering... should ~name~ even be at this table?

Oh, ~name~, you seem to be a musician of some kind! What instrument do you play? ...would you be interested in a duet?
Hmm... ~name~, you don't speak very much, do you?
You know, ~name~, I've been wondering: how do you deal with hair as long as yours? I know mine can be kind of a pain, at times...
...~name~? Why did you bring a weapon to the table? We're not playing for cash or anything, just dignity.
W-whoa, ~name~, how did you get hair like that? Y-you're not secretly hundreds of years old, are you?
Hm... ~name~, those wings seem like a bit of a pain to manage. How do you do it?
You're a teacher, right, ~name~? Is there a subject you enjoy the most? I know I prefer creative writing, since it helps me get inspired to write poems.
~Name~, you're a magical girl of some kind, right? So what's your special gimmick? Or do you just have the stereotypical magic, speed, and strength power package?
Oh, you work in law, ~target~? I've read a couple John Grisham novels, but I'm not sure how true to life they are.
An espionage agent? I hope that's not as dangerous as stuff like The Bourne Identity would suggest. Ahaha~
You're involved with intelligence, ~target~? Ever read Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy, or do you prefer to keep work at work? Ahaha~
You're a bounty hunter, ~target~? I can't say I know much about that, aside from what I remember from One for the Money. That's more on the comedy end of things, though. Ehehe~
You're into coding, ~target~? I'm something of a programmer myself.
You're a coder, ~target~? I learned a bit about the culture around it in Little Brother, but I'm still a novice at the actual practice.
I read Treasure Island in middle school, so it's fascinating to meet someone who feels like they walked out of it! Ahaha~

You work in law enforcement, ~target~? I read a crime novel, Find Me in the Dark, recently-- ever heard of it?
Friendly work of advice, ~target~-- this is only weird if you make it weird.

case.state: I'm so glad that you're looking out for our newest member, Yuri. Hoping to get a little closer through some skinship?
I'm so glad that you're looking out for our newest member, Yuri. Planning on making use of your feminine charms on him?
That's good to hear, but I still don't know what specific things I should help her with.
I'm glad to hear that could be the case. Still, I wish I knew what specific ways we could help her.
Futo? I'm not sure I get the reference, but Natsuki is the shortest member of our club.
Well, anyways, as I was saying before... I get the feeling that you and Yuri would get along really well, Saki.
Well, anyways, as I was saying before... I think you and Yuri should get to know each other. I'd think you'd find a lot of common ground.
Ahaha, sorry. On Earth, people only go to space for very specific reasons. Putting someone into orbit is very expensive, so it's usually only for, say, research or satellite maintenance.
Ehehe, good point. A mission to space is a costly endeavor, so there's almost always a task involved, like zero-G experiments or repair of a satellite.
Perhaps... Maybe we're seeking the same thing, but using different words for it.
"Eternal celestial"? I do want to... transcend my world in a way, though that's not how I'd describe it myself. It could be that we're after the same thing...
That's quite the time commitment! I understand the appeal, but what part of that do you find the most fulfilling?
You're very kind to spend so much time helping them out. Which aspect of volunteering there is your favorite, you find?
Could you share some tips on negotiating prices? My club doesn't have much of a budget, so anything helps!
Are there any haggling tactics that work particularly well? I'd love to be able to make the best use of our tiny club budget.
That's unfortunate. Would you like to visit our school's library sometime? I'm sure I could get permission from the staff.
I'm sorry to hear that. Perhaps you'd like to pay a visit to my school's library? I don't think any teachers would object.
Do members of your crew often reminisce about their time before becoming pirates, or was it hard for them before as well?
